American University of Beiru[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”Biography” font_container=”tag:h5|text_align:left|color:%231e73be” google_fonts=”font_family:Raleway%3A100%2C200%2C300%2Cregular%2C500%2C600%2C700%2C800%2C900|font_style:900%20bold%20regular%3A900%3Anormal” css=”.vc_custom_1665020463869{margin-top: 0px !important;margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”][vc_column_text el_class=”SpTitlesFull”]Professor Walid Ghazi Faraj is currently the Head of the Division of General Surgery at the American University of Beirut Medical Center, Lebanon ( On leave ) and a Consultant Surgeon at Clemenceau Medical Center Dubai, UAE. He has extensive experience in Liver Transplant and Hepatopancreaticobiliary Surgery and represents Lebanon in the Arab Board of Surgery. Dr Faraj completed his advanced fellowship training at Kings College Hospital, UK. He is involved in a busy surgical oncology practice at AUBMC which is a regional referral center. He has an extensive research portfolio with more than 100 publications in peer review journals. He is a member of the International Relations Committee of the American College of Surgeons[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row]
